Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery type B cup; interior: within a border of stopt maeander, red-figure decoration consisting of part of foot and himation of a male figure, moving to right; exterior: stopt maeander and chequer-square below frieze in which is preserved the heel of male figure, possibly Herakles, standing to left with red string round the ankle; inscription on interior.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The Brygos Painter
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Beazle (CVA) notes that the sherd belongs somewhere in the neighbourhood of the Brygos Painter.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 515-6, no. C92)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0657) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 12-3, pl. XIV, no. 12)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
